faculty.note: The Health Sciences faculty focuses on training competent pharmacy technicians with strong theoretical and practical skills for the Ghanaian healthcare system.

levels.fees: Ghanaian Students: GHS 8,000 - GHS 10,000 per year (estimated, three-year HND band for private institutions)

salary.Ghana: GHS 24,000 - GHS 48,000 per year (entry to mid-level pharmacy technician roles)
salary.USA: USD 32,000 - USD 55,000 per year (pharmacy technician roles)

levels.cutt_off: Typical HND admission equivalent of WASSCE aggregate 18 - 30 with strong science passes, subject to Pharmacy Council standards
levels.mode: Primarily in-person with laboratory work, simulations and supervised clinical/dispensing placements.
levels.entry_requirements: Applicants generally require passes in three core subjects including English Language, Core Mathematics and Integrated Science, plus at least three relevant science electives such as Biology, Chemistry and Elective Mathematics or Physics at WASSCE level, meeting minimum aggregate requirements set for HND Health Sciences programmes. Mature applicants must be at least 25 years old with relevant work experience and pass the required entrance examination and/or interview as outlined by the university.
levels.level_note: The programme combines pharmaceutical chemistry, pharmacology, drug formulation and quality assurance with supervised practical training in accredited pharmacies and health facilities. Graduates are prepared to support pharmacists in hospitals, community pharmacies and other healthcare settings in line with Pharmacy Council accreditation requirements.

faculty.note: The Theology and Ministry faculty provides biblically grounded, contextually relevant training for Christian ministry, missions, education and leadership in Africa and beyond.

career: Community Development Officer in Faith-Based Organisations

levels.fees: Ghanaian Students: GHS 10,000 - GHS 14,000 per year (estimated private Christian university band)

required: Christian Religious Studies or Bible Knowledge (where available)
additional: Any other arts or social science elective

salary.Ghana: GHS 18,000 - GHS 42,000 per year (church and ministry roles, highly variable by denomination and organisation)
salary.USA: USD 30,000 - USD 65,000 per year (ministry roles, highly variable)

levels.cutt_off: Typical WASSCE aggregate 18 - 30 for private theology programmes with required subject passes
levels.mode: In-person lectures, seminars, chapel services and ministry formation activities with some blended online support for readings and assignments.
levels.entry_requirements: WASSCE applicants are usually required to have at least six passes including three core subjects (English Language, Core Mathematics and either Social Studies or Integrated Science) and three electives in arts or social science subjects such as Christian Religious Studies, Literature in English, History, Government or related fields, meeting an aggregate not exceeding 36. Mature applicants must normally be at least 25 years old with relevant ministry experience and pass the university’s entrance examination and/or interview as specified in its admission policies.
levels.level_note: The BA in Theology includes modules in biblical studies, church history, systematic theology, Christian ethics and pastoral ministry. Students are prepared for a wide range of ministry and Christian service roles and may progress to postgraduate theological studies.

courses.course_name: Masters of Arts in African Christianity
career: Lecturer or Tutor in African Christianity (with further academic progression)
Consultant on African Christian Theology and Practice
Doctoral Candidate in Theology or Religious Studies

levels.fees: Ghanaian Students: GHS 18,000 - GHS 25,000 total for the MA (estimated sandwich postgraduate band)
levels.duration: Sandwich structure: 3 sessions of intensive coursework typically spread over 1.5 - 2 years

required: Christianity and Social Issues in Africa

salary.Ghana: GHS 30,000 - GHS 70,000 per year (senior ministry, teaching and NGO roles, depending on organisation and experience)
salary.USA: USD 35,000 - USD 80,000 per year (ministry and academic-related roles, highly variable)

levels.cutt_off: Postgraduate admission based on quality of first degree rather than WASSCE aggregates; typically lower-second class or better in a relevant field
levels.mode: Sandwich mode with 4-week intensive blocks of coursework over three sessions (September–December, January–April, May–August), combining seminars, research and independent study.
levels.entry_requirements: Admission typically requires a first degree in any field from a recognised university or a first degree in theology from an accredited institution, together with evidence of active Christian ministry and a successful admission interview. Applicants are expected to demonstrate readiness for postgraduate theological research and engagement with the African Christian context.
levels.level_note: The MA in African Christianity focuses on the history, theology and practices of Christianity in Africa, including interaction with African traditional religions and contemporary social issues. The programme equips students for advanced ministry, teaching, research and leadership within African churches and faith-based organisations.

career: Curriculum Developer for Churches and Bible Schools
Ministry Leader with Strong Teaching Focus
Doctoral Candidate in Biblical Studies or Theology

levels.fees: Ghanaian Students: GHS 18,000 - GHS 25,000 total for the MA (estimated sandwich postgraduate band)
levels.duration: Sandwich structure: 3 sessions of intensive coursework typically completed in 1.5 - 2 years

salary.Ghana: GHS 30,000 - GHS 70,000 per year (teaching and ministry roles, depending on institution and experience)

levels.cutt_off: Postgraduate selection depends on undergraduate performance, typically a good first degree in theology or a related field, not WASSCE aggregates
levels.mode: MA sandwich with 4-week intensive course blocks delivered over three sessions each academic year, supported by supervised research and independent reading.
levels.entry_requirements: Applicants are generally required to hold a first degree in any discipline from a recognised university or a first degree in theology from an accredited institution, provide proof of involvement in Christian ministry, and pass an admission interview. Strong interest in biblical research and teaching is expected for this programme.
levels.level_note: The MA in Biblical Studies deepens students’ understanding of the literature, history and theology of the Old and New Testaments and trains them in careful interpretation of biblical texts. Graduates are equipped to teach the Bible responsibly in churches, Bible schools and other Christian education settings and to pursue further academic research.

Doctoral Candidate in Theology or Ministry

additional: Project or Dissertation in Theological Studies

salary.Ghana: GHS 30,000 - GHS 75,000 per year (senior ministry and leadership roles, depending on context)

levels.cutt_off: Selection is based on prior degree classification and ministry profile rather than WASSCE aggregates; usually at least a good first degree
levels.mode: MA sandwich with 4-week blocks of intensive coursework each session (September–December, January–April, May–August), combined with guided research and ministry-focused projects.
levels.entry_requirements: Candidates are expected to hold a first degree in any discipline or in theology from a recognised university, demonstrate active involvement in ministry, and successfully pass the programme’s admission interview. Applicants should show capacity for advanced theological reflection and research as described in the university’s entry requirement guidelines.
levels.level_note: The MA in Theological Studies provides advanced exploration of key areas of Christian theology, church history, ethics and ministry practice. The programme is designed to deepen students’ understanding of the Christian faith and to strengthen their capacity for leadership, teaching and reflection in church and society.
